greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of odd primes dividing n.
comment: Primes counted without multiplicity. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 28 2019
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Additive with a(p^e) = 0 if p = 2, p otherwise.
G.f.: Sum_{k>=2} prime(k)*x^prime(k)/(1 - x^prime(k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 24 2016
a(1) = 0; after which, for even n: a(n) = a(n/2), for odd n: a(n) = A020639(n) + a(A028234(n)).
mathematica: a = {0, 0}; For[n = 3, n < 80, n++, su = 0; b = FactorInteger[n]; For[i = 1, i < Length[b] + 1, i++, If[OddQ[b[[i, 1]]], su = su + b[[i, 1]]]]; AppendTo[a, su]]; a (* _Stefan Steinerberger_, Jun 02 2007 *)
Array[DivisorSum[#, # &, And[PrimeQ@ #, OddQ@ #] &] &, 79] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 11 2017 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A005069 n) (cond ((= 1 n) 0) ((even? n) (A005069 (/ n 2))) (else (+ (A020639 n) (A005069 (A028234 n)))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 10 2017
(PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, if (((p=f[k,1])%2) == 1, p)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 11 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
